Text in bubble: On average it takes 5â€“6 days from when someone is infected with the virus for symptoms to show. Most common symptoms include fever.
In severe cases, symptoms could start to worsen. Patients may have difficulty breathing, especially if they are older or have a preexisting health condition.

By this point, patients with severe cases will have most likely developed shortness of breath, pneumonia, or acute respiratory distress syndrome, an illness that may require intubation. ARDS is often fatal.

If patients have worsening symptoms, this is the time in the disease's progression when they're likely to be admitted to the ICU. These patients probably have more abdominal pain and appetite loss than patients with milder cases.
For those who will survive the virus, breathing difficulties are generally ending on these days.
On average, people either recovered from the virus and were discharged from the hospital or passed away.
